sanskrit_verse:
पित्र्ये स्वदितमित्येव वाच्यं गोष्ठे तु सुशृतम् ।
सम्पन्नमित्यभ्युदये दैवे रुचितमित्यपि ॥ ३.२५४॥
transliteration: pitrye svaditamityeva vācyaṃ goṣṭhe tu suśrutam | sampannamityabhyudaye daive rucitamityapi || 3.254 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: In the ancestral domain, what is pleasing to the father alone shall be declared; in the community, that which is well-heard and accepted. At the time of prosperity, declare it as accomplished; in divine matters, as agreeable to the will of the gods.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through lineage and tradition
Prosperity validates completion of dharmic action
executable_legal_axioms: IF context = ancestral THEN utterance_validity = based_on_paternal_acceptance
IF context = communal THEN utterance_validity = based_on_collective_recognition
IF state = prosperous THEN action_status = declared_complete
IF domain = divine THEN approval_source = celestial_will
supreme_court_application: At the highest judicial level, declarations must distinguish between ancestral authority, communal consensus, material success, and divine sanction. The court must recognize hierarchical epistemic sources and apply rulings accordingly without conflating domains.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based discernment ensures correct classification of utterances per domain. Sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) aligns speech with its rightful contextual basis. Responsibility lies in accurate alignment, not punitive correction. Truth emerges via proper categorization, restoring order without blame.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Reclassification of utterance within correct jurisdictional domain
Realignment of speaker with appropriate source of validation
Divine harmony confirmation where celestial will applies
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma is sourced, declared, and restored. Law executes from consciousness itself—non-punitive, absolute, and complete.
